comments.body: Would it make sense to throw an exception here instead of fallback to Scala211? It's not idiomatic Scala to silently fall back to Scala211, but maybe it makes more sense in js.
Right, probably if you pass a wrong one you want to know. It makes sense I'll report an error (instead of throwing an exception)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +216,220 @@         |  2,
         |)""".stripMargin
    val parsedDefaultDialect = JSFacade.parseStat(code, js.Dictionary("dialect" -> "wrong"))
    val expected = d(
      "error" -> "'wrong' is not a valid dialect."
